# Scale: Harmonic in C (Mode: Locrian #6, Shape: E)

The Harmonic scale in C, also known as the Locrian #6 mode with Shape E, is a unique and exotic scale that can add an intriguing and mysterious flavor to your music. It is derived from the 6th mode of the Melodic Minor scale and has a distinctive sound due to its intervals.


## Notes and Intervals:

The notes in the Harmonic scale in C (Mode: Locrian #6, Shape: E) are as follows:
- C (Root)
- D (Minor 2nd)
- Eb (Minor 3rd)
- F (Perfect 4th)
- Gb (Diminished 5th)
- Ab (Minor 6th)
- B (Major 7th)

The intervals in this scale create a dissonant and tense sound due to the diminished 5th (Gb) and the minor 2nd (D) intervals.


## Genre and Musical Flavor:

The Harmonic scale in C (Mode: Locrian #6, Shape: E) is not as commonly used as other scales, but it can be found in various genres such as jazz, fusion, and progressive rock. Its exotic and mysterious sound makes it suitable for creating tension and adding a unique flavor to compositions.
